question: In which one of the following nations "Somapura Mahavihara", a UNESCO World Heritage Site, is located?
explanation: Somapura Mahavihara is also known as Paharpur Buddhist Bihar. It is a UNESCO World Heritage Site. It was built for Dharma Pala. It is based on the Gupta and Pala style of architecture. In Buddhist vihar, several Hindu statues were also seen.
